intro: Dubautia herbstobatae, commonly known as the Hana Mountain Dubautia, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations on the island of Maui. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in sunny, coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
